abstract: Britain's Independent Police Complaints Commission plans to investigate allegations that criminal prosecution in Wiltshire was dropped in 1990s after suspect threatened to expose former Conservative prime minister Edward Heath as child molester.
lead_paragraph: An independent agency will look into whether an inquiry was dropped when a subject threatened to go public with accusations that former Prime Minister Edward Heath had sexually abused children.

headline.main: British Police to Review Sex Abuse Claims Against Ex-Premier Edward Heath
headline.print_headline: British Police to Review Abuse Claims Against Ex-Premier

snippet: An independent agency will look into whether an inquiry was dropped when a subject threatened to go public with accusations that former Prime Minister Edward Heath had sexually abused children.
